DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Scan Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date a PET/CT scan was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to PET/CT scan performed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Scanning Systems, Computed Tomography/Positron Emission Tomography
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Scanning systems that combine computed tomography (CT) and positron emission tomography (PET) capabilities. These systems may consist either of CT and PET scanners mounted in a common mechanical support within a single gantry or open design CT and PT scanners that permit the separation of both CT and PET as stand-alone scanning systems. They also include common tables, workstation, monitors, and appropriate software to align the CT and PET images. Both configurations may be used when needed for separate CT and PET studies without loss of technical performance. The system provides fusion (i.e., integration) of anatomical images provided by the CT slices with the functional (metabolic) images from the PET scanning taken in the same session with the patient in treatment position. CT/PET combined systems are intended for faster and more accurate evaluations; they are mostly used for the diagnoses, treatment planning, and tracking the progress of therapy in cancer patients, characterizing the disease by both its anatomic and biological features.

Concepts.longName: Scanning Systems, Computed Tomography/Positron Emission Tomography
Concepts.definition: Scanning systems that combine computed tomography (CT) and positron emission tomography (PET) capabilities. These systems may consist either of CT and PET scanners mounted in a common mechanical support within a single gantry or open design CT and PT scanners that permit the separation of both CT and PET as stand-alone scanning systems. They also include common tables, workstation, monitors, and appropriate software to align the CT and PET images. Both configurations may be used when needed for separate CT and PET studies without loss of technical performance. The system provides fusion (i.e., integration) of anatomical images provided by the CT slices with the functional (metabolic) images from the PET scanning taken in the same session with the patient in treatment position. CT/PET combined systems are intended for faster and more accurate evaluations; they are mostly used for the diagnoses, treatment planning, and tracking the progress of therapy in cancer patients, characterizing the disease by both its anatomic and biological features.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
